Module InternationalPokemonTradeTool
Package main.java.tradingEngine.gameData

Class Pokemon

java.lang.Object
main.java.tradingEngine.gameData.Pokemon
public class Pokemon extends Object
This class is meant to store a Pokémon's data.

  • Field Details

      public static final Pokemon BLANK_SPACE

  • Constructor Details

    • Pokemon

      public Pokemon(byte[] data, byte[] trainerName, byte[] nickname, Language language)
      The main constructor that basically takes raw data and interpret them as a Pokémon. The main data section must either be 44 bytes (if in party) or 33 bytes long (if in a box).
      Parameters:
      data - an array containing every single byte in a Pokémon's main data
      trainerName - the original trainer name as an encoded in-game string
      nickname - the Pokémon's nickname as an encoded in-game string
      language - the Pokémon's language (Japanese or Western)
      See Also:
      • InGameString

    • getEvs

      public int[] getEvs()
      Returns an array containing every the effort value of every stat in the following order : HP, ATTACK, DEFENSE, SPEED, SPECIAL (in Gen2, Special Attack and Special Defense share the same EV and IV).
      Returns:
      the EVs.

    • getIvs

      public int[] getIvs()
      Returns an array containing every the individual value of every stat in the following order : HP, ATTACK, DEFENSE, SPEED, SPECIAL (in Gen2, Special Attack and Special Defense share the same EV and IV).
      Returns:
      the IVs.

    • getMovesPps

      public int[] getMovesPps()
      Returns the Pokémon's pps value (each value contains the remaining pp of the move and the number of used pp ups).
      Returns:
      the moves' pp values

      the Pokémon's language

    • setLanguage

      public void setLanguage(Language language)
      Change the Pokémon's language. This will get rid of its nickname and trainer name, because these can't be converted.
      Parameters:
      language - the new Pokémon language (gets set to Western if it's any of the Western languages)

    • setNickname

      public void setNickname(String nickname)
      Sets the Pokémon's nickname from a String.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the new Pokémon's nickname
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name's size is invalid or if it contains illegal characters
      See Also:
      • InGameString

    • setTrainerName

      public void setTrainerName(String trainerName)
      Sets the Pokémon's trainer name from a String.
      Parameters:
      trainerName - the new Pokémon's trainer name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name's size is invalid or if it contains illegal characters
      See Also:
      • InGameString
